Documentation.UserDocu: This object allows the computation of wind spectrum using the Kaimal spectrum

double computeAlongWindAutoSpectrum(frequency, height, meanSpeed, shearVelocity, Par1 = 200.0, Par2 = 50.0); frequency = the frequency value for which the spectrum will be calculated height = the height at which the spectrum will be calculated meanSpeed = the mean wind speed shearVelocity = the shear velocity of the flow Part1, Part2 = some constants.

double computeAcrossWindAutoSpectrum(frequency, height, meanSpeed, shearVelocity, Par1 = 17.0, Par2 = 9.5); frequency = the frequency value for which the spectrum will be calculated height = the height at which the spectrum will be calculated meanSpeed = the mean wind speed shearVelocity = the shear velocity of the flow Part1, Part2 = some constants.

double computeVerticalWindAutoSpectrum(frequency, height, meanSpeed, shearVelocity, Par1 = 2.0, Par2 = 5.3); frequency = the frequency value for which the spectrum will be calculated height = the height at which the spectrum will be calculated meanSpeed = the mean wind speed shearVelocity = the shear velocity of the flow Part1, Part2 = some constants.
